holidays.description: A day to celebrate the importance of literacy as a matter of dignity and human rights.
holidays.origin: Established by UNESCO in 1966 to raise awareness about illiteracy around the world.
holidays.funFact: Despite its serious theme, some communities hold quirky 'read-a-thons' dressed as their favorite book characters to make literacy fun!

holidays.name: National Ampersand Day &
holidays.description: A celebration of the humble ampersand (&) symbol, honoring its quirky charm and historical importance in written language.
holidays.origin: Originated informally among typophiles and graphic designers appreciating this unique character.
holidays.funFact: The ampersand was originally a ligature of the letters 'e' and 't' (Latin for 'and'), making it literally a blend of two letters!
